definitions.definition: To make a living; earn money for necessities .
examples: It is difficult to provide for my family working on minimum wage.

definitions.definition: To act to prepare for something.
To establish as a previous condition; to stipulate .
examples: The contract provides that the work be well done.
I'll lend you the money, provided that you pay it back by Monday.

definitions.definition: To give what is needed or desired, especially basic needs .
examples: Don't bother bringing equipment, as we will provide it.
We aim to provide the local community with more green spaces.

definitions.definition: To furnish (with), cause to be present, supply.

examples: He provides us with an alternative option.

definitions.definition: To foresee , to consider in advance .
To appoint to an ecclesiastical benefice before it is vacant . See provisor .

main_definition: To make a living; earn money for necessities .
secondary_definitions: To act to prepare for something.
To establish as a previous condition; to stipulate .
To give what is needed or desired, especially basic needs .
To furnish (with), cause to be present, supply.
( obsolete , Latinism ) To foresee , to consider in advance .
To appoint to an ecclesiastical benefice before it is vacant . See provisor .
